thread.title: High-flying Dallas architect Merriman Anderson ups its game with new principals | Real Estate | Dallas News
thread.title_full: High-flying Dallas architect Merriman Anderson ups its game with new principals | Real Estate | Dallas News

title: High-flying Dallas architect Merriman Anderson ups its game with new principals | Real Estate | Dallas News
text:
Get Unlimited Digital Access Your first month is less than a dollar. $0.99 for first 4 weeks Subscribe Now 
One of Dallas' busiest architects has more than doubled the size of its stakeholders. 
Merriman Anderson/Architects Inc. â which has a hand in some of downtown's biggest developments â is promoting seven of its associates to principal shareholders. 
The 30-year-old design company had previously been owned by Jerry and Deby Merriman and Milton Anderson. 
The company has promoted to shareholders David Masters, John Carruth, Aimee Sanborn, Philip Siems, Adam Jones, Justin McCarthy and Jennifer Picquet-Reyes. 
It's only the second time Merriman Anderson/Architects has grown its ownership cadre. 
"We want to have our core group of leaders in place for the next 20 or 25 years," Jerry Merriman said. "They have all been with us for over 10 years and they are the right people to keep our firm going down the road." 
With nearly 90 employees, the firm also has offices in Austin and Charlotte, N. C. 
Some of its notable North Texas projects include Bell Helicopter Global Headquarters in Fort Worth, The Drever development at 1401 Elm St. in downtown Dallas and the Statler Hotel renovation on Commerce Street. 
Merriman said expansion of the company's owners will help ensure future success. 
"Some really good firms through the years didn't have that next generation ready when they needed them," he said. "Most of these people we are promoting are between 30 and 40 and have been with us since their late 20s." 
Merriman Anderson/Architects has expanded its ownership group by seven principals. From left: Milton Anderson, Adam Jones, Aimee Sanborn, Philip Siems, David Masters, John Carruth, Justin McCarthy, Jennifer Picquet-Reyes, Jerry Merriman, Deby Merriman (MMA)
